This test is performed on a blood sample. The blood is obtained from the vein and this is performed by a healthcare provider in the following way.
clean the skin put an elastic band above the area insert a needle into a vein (usually in the arm inside of the elbow or on the back of the hand) pull the blood sample into a vial or syringe take off the elastic band and remove the needle from the vein

Do not take paracetamol and tell your doctor if:
You are allergic to the active substance or any of the other ingredients in your medicine (listed in Section 6). Signs of an allergic reaction include a rash and breathing problems. There can also be swelling of the legs, arms, face, throat or tongue Children
Paracetamol 500mg Tablets must not be given to children under 10 years of age.
